website_summaries.verdict: A precise digital caliper that will fit easily into your budget and is ready to go right out of the box.
pros: Takes external, internal, depth and step measurements
Hard plastic case and spare battery included
cons: Reports measurements in 1/128 of an inch, which some users find impractical for their needs

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!!
customer_reviews.text: Impressive! I'm an older person, using tools since the early 1960's. To have access to this level of quality and accuracy for just a few bucks is quite a treat. In my day a decent mechanical dial caliper would cost a few day's pay or more! I still have several of my old measuring tools and their standards. This measures the standards at least as well as the old mechanical stuff. Not quite as elegant or familiar, but light, accurate so far, and handy just the same. Welcome to the new world!
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: looks nice but malfunctions a lot
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately the readings jump all over the place. i continue to reset and zero out but i can not depend on it. guess i will order another brand. purchased in January but didn't start using it till a couple of weeks ago. By the time i figured out it malfunctioned it was too late to return......
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Works but is sick
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for about 10 months. I've not used it much, been careful with it, and always stored it in its case. It is impossible to shut off, or on rare occasions when it does shut off, it turns itself back on even if it is not moving. Right now it is generating random numbers that are all over the place. It takes a lot of effort to calm it down so that I can measure with it. I've tried removing the battery and replacing and it makes no difference. It's a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Hobo

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one year
customer_reviews.text: This caliper ate batteries for lunch for the entire year I owned it. Because it would not turn off, you couldn't keep a battery in there for more than a few weeks. Today, it started showing measurements ranging from -453mm to the measurement of what I was measuring - aka it's now useless. Anything that can't last a year of normal usage is trash . Don't buy this one twice, get a good one for a little more money and only buy once.
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: Works but has no auto-shutoff feature
customer_reviews.text: The battery died the second time I used it. My other caliper has an automatic shutoff feature, but for some reason this one doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Reader10928

customer_reviews.title: Junk, Unstable, won't turn off, losses zero
customer_reviews.text: I own several low priced digital calipers from HF and such. I ordered one of these as an old one of many years died. This is the worse caliber i have ever owned. During use it will frequently loss zero position, and you have to stop and reset zero, and make sure you don't open it to fast or it will loss zero again. Many times the one off switch will not turn it off, fortunately it will eventually time out and turn it self off, or it would kill batteries. This tool is unstable and can't be trusted for accurate measurement, I would recommend trying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Aa

customer_reviews.title: ... about calipers and this one did not get the best reviews. However
customer_reviews.text: I did some 'research' about calipers and this one did not get the best reviews. However, while calipers are VERY helpful when you need them, I don't need them that much. I use it maybe a few times a month. Hence, if I need to take 2-3 measurements to make sure the result is consistent, then that's just fine with me. I would do this even with high-end calipers. So far the results have been consistent so I am not concerned about the accuracy/reference point. Also note that for my needs I really don't need the most accurate measurement. If I am within 0.1mm (about 4 thou/mil) than that's plenty accurate enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: book guru

customer_reviews.title: Nice little digital caliper
customer_reviews.text: This cheap caliper has saved my bacon over and over in my 3d printing escapades. As far as I can tell it is accurate, it measures every which way, and the case it comes in has not failed yet. i hav dropped it from my table a couple of times, no trouble. YMMV. I have used it to determine the exact diameter of filament, used it to do set up measurements when I built my reprap kit. You need one of these or something exactly like it to make 3d printing go well. Excellent buy, excellent tool. Mine came with a battery installed and a spare,
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Simicich

customer_reviews.title: This is the same thing as Neiko 01407A
customer_reviews.text: I bought this VINCA at a discounted price. Compared with Neiko 01407A, there are the same thing. Very big chance that they are manufactured in the same factory only with different branding. Same metal parts and same controller, if you are struggling on which one to get like I did, just get the cheaper one in these two. Build quality is not the best, but worth the money, I bought it for 3D printing so it's good enough. 5 star for the price.
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad spot on display - see attached pictures
customer_reviews.text: I purchased after reading the large amount of positive reviews and comments. I think I may have just gotten a lemon. I opened the box and the numbers were already on, but very dim like there was a bad spot on the electronic display. I replayed the battery with those provided (thanks for the extra batteries) and even with the fresh battery, the display still had bad spots. I took pictures. I am hoping for a replacement, and will update my review as long as the next set lacks the display issue. I purchased to check some levels, and it appears accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Colonel Angus

customer_reviews.title: A Price That Measures Up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these calipers as a cheaper alternative to some of the Highly Precise and EXPENSIVE alternatives out there. I dabble in 3D Printing and Design and needed something that would do the job. I didn't NEED bulletproof precision and took the gamble on these despite the reputation of nearly all cheap calipers being inconsistent and incapable of fine measurements. While these do vary by 3 to 5 hundredth of a millimeter from one measurement to another, it's not enough to affect my work. I'm quite pleased with the construction, ease of use and motion, and the clear readout. These calipers are absolutely worth the price and more than accurate enough for the work I do.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality for the $22 price.
customer_reviews.text: These calipers are a great choice for someone looking to get a decent pair of calipers without breaking the bank. I have Mitutoyos and Starrett calipers that I prefer, but I find myself using these in situations where I know that dropping them or getting them filthy is more likely. I used to use a very cheap "workhorse" caliper for situations like that, but the really cheap models often aren't as accurate, precise, or repeatable as I would have liked. Since switching to these, I find that they serve their purpose quite well and are not only a pair of calipers I can afford to drop, but also are made well and give me high quality measurements.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Not going to last...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great initially. Then it failed completely where the display would constantly change. I tried pushing / jiggling the buttons in case one was stuck down, tried power cycling (which took a number of tries). I even put in a brand new battery. The values on the display are still changing constantly (I took the video after changing the battery). I probably only used it five times, and then when I went to use it the sixth time this is what it was doing (see attached video).
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: The tool works fine. As far as I can tell (no standards to measure) the readings are accurate and definitely consistent. Judging from how printed parts are fitting with independent items like screws, accuracy seems to be reasonable. My only complaint is that the thumb screw on the side that is supposed to adjust the ease with which the jaws slide is inconsistent. If it's set correcting at one end of the slide, it is way to tight or loose (depending on travel direction) at the other end. I consider it a minor but slightly irritating complaint. I'm not sure why it does that, but I don't see any way to correct it.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I use this caliper for fine woodworking...pens, corkscrews, and similar small items turned from exotic woods. It very likely provides more precision than anyone other than me would notice. For example, my wood turnings now fit the hardware of my various pens to within hundredths of a millimeter. Far more than a smooth butt joint...a close to perfect butt joint. The handles on my corkscrews match lengths to within hundredths of a millimeter...far more precise than anyone would ever notice, other than me. A solid, mid-priced instrument that is a joy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. ROY EARLE

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I'll see how this holds up in coming months/years, but after using it right away and inspecting things like drill bits and Carburetor measurement tools, it seems well made and accurate. Display is nice. Slide feels good. Comes with 2 spare batteries, nice!. Case is nice. Zero-out is easy. M.M./ INCHES/ FRACTIONS. Has auto- off after 10min. Has auto-on once you begin to open(slide). P.s. When not in use, just close it down, tighten lock screw, then press off, and pack away. So far I don't have anything negative to state. If I encounter any issues I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy G.

customer_reviews.title: An impressive quality caliper at a bargain price.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a caliper for home use and was looking for an economical but well made caliper. I use it for both wood and metal work so measurement scale flexibility is important. This caliper greatly exceeds my expectations. The quality of the construction is impressive. It is the least expensive and yet the favorite of my calipers. The ability to change the scale at the push of a button is very helpful and the thumb wheel makes one handed measurement quick, easy, and accurate. The caliper comes in a reusable sturdy plastic storage box and includes a spare battery. I highly recommend this caliper. For the price, you simply can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Fillmore2

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Great construction. Includes protective case and replacement batteries
customer_reviews.text: I have ALWAYS wanted to own my own caliper. This thing has a digital display which can be easily read and can be set to inches or mm units. Super easy On/Off and Zero controls. Solid construction. And wow - a case to boot! Using this thing is super easy - really. With it, you can measure OD (outside diameter), ID (inside diameter), Depth, or Length. Who knew taking measurements could be so straight-forward, easy and fun. And with an optional module, the caliper can be interfaced to a computer. 1yr warranty extended to 2yrs when you register online.
customer_reviews.author: STF

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this caliper 2 years ago and like it's accuracy very much. BUT, like I said I bought this 2 years ago and while changing the battery the little battery cover flew off to parts unknown. I looked everywhere, moved stuff in the shop and came up empty. I emailed Clockwise Tools and asked if I could buy a replacement, thinking that they probably don't stock a little thing like that. To my surprise they cheerfully mailed out 2 replacement covers AT NO CHARGE. Colockwise Tools is a great company that makes great measuring devises. Buy their product knowing their customer service will be the best you will ever get!
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Super accurate, very nice to look at.
customer_reviews.text: This tool has really exceeded my expectations. The accuracy is hands down the best I have experienced with one of these, I would even go as far to say that it "could" be better than its specs say. I have owned it for about a year now and am on the second battery (which it comes with) Never has it given my any trouble and I use it a few times a week on average, mainly for indoor projects so I can no report on how well it would be under extreme conditions. This far exceeds the quality of the Matco brand tool I use daily at work which i'm sure was triple the price. This is a great tool
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Bruno

customer_reviews.title: good enough where it counts.
customer_reviews.text: With any measuring instrument, its important to have consistent results when using the same device. if you use multiple devices, they need to be consistent to each other. This is my only digital caliper. When i use it, it is consistent within itself. I'm not sure how accurate it is, but I don't care. I'm sure as I purchase more tools and start going further down the fabrication rabbit hole, I will need to reevaluate this unit's accuracy compared to others. It will give me the same measurement when taken multiple times, even with resetting zero in between measurements. Its built well, I've accidentally knocked it off the counter top & nothing bent or was damaged.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these
customer_reviews.text: I've had these calipers for about 6 months. I use them all the time for woodworking. They work great, never had a problem. Maintains calibration extremely well, very rarely have to reset. I was worried about battery life since they seem to turn on if you just barely bump them. But not a problem so far. I bought a digital bevel gauge at the same time I got these calipers. It died a quick death, digital gauge stopped working a couple months ago, and I used it a lot less than I use these calipers. Made me appreciate the calipers all the more.
customer_reviews.author: Grasshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap calipers
customer_reviews.text: I needed a caliper for work, and my 25 year-old Sylvac is too precious to bring in so I figured I'd take a gamble on this and couldn't be happier. * There is no play at all, * It goes back to zero when I close it, * The case closes well and is durable, * It powers off automatically, so it's still using the battery that came in it after almost a year. Compared to the cheap flaky calipers knocking around my office (Husky, Neiko, no-name), this feels like a big step up.
customer_reviews.author: salsaman

customer_reviews.title: Great Digital Caliper
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tool to make sure all the parts on my bike are the correct size for replacements and upgrades. Having a digital caliper has been most useful on numerous occasions. The digital readout is handy for accuracy and switching between different units. Honestly, I never thought I would use it as, much as I have. It is my goto measuring tool when I need to find distance in mm or finding diameter values. This unit came with a nice storage case and extra battery. Maybe the best 20 bucks I have ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K

customer_reviews.title: Its no mitutoyo..
customer_reviews.text: Seems accurate. I'm using it for 3d printing. It's no mitutoyo but you get what you pay for. It's in a standby state so if you move it when it's off it will power on. I suggest using the lock screw to keep it tight. It also comes with an extra battery for when it does die.
customer_reviews.author: Pork Chop

customer_reviews.title: Very nice digital caliper tool!
customer_reviews.text: Although it was delivered yesterday, I stowed it away in the garage for a day due to the COVID-19. Once I wiped the entire package down it was time to finally unwrap it and put this tool in my hands. Even though I've never used digital calipers before, the instruction booklet and the simplicity of the tool made it very easy to get use to. Overall this is more than what it cost. It appears to be durable and gives three units of measurements. You also receive two, yes two extra button batteries and a hard plastic case to store everything in. I definitely will recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: BRAVO_X-RAY

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle O-Ring Chain rivet installation.
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to install a new o-ring chain on a motorcycle I recommend this digital caliper measurement tool because it is accurate. Don't guess when installing the master link rivets. The rivets must be within tolerance during installation when mushroomed. Measure them with a good digital caliper micrometer. I measured the OEM rivet after removing the link with this tool. The rivet diameter was spot on with manufactures specs. I then measured the OEM rivet mushroom and it was also within the service manuals specifications. I feel confident that when I install the new master link I will be able to measure accurately if I got it right, or not.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Maupin

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money and very accurate. Great seller who backs up his product.
customer_reviews.text: I put the 8" calipers through the test reloading several hundred rounds of ammo. I checked it against my Starrett calipers and it was spot on every time. Always returned to zero. Very pleased with these calipers. The 6" calipers kept getting .005 thousands off constantly and this was a problem for me. I contacted the seller and he immediately replaced the 6" calipers. This new set so far has worked flawlessly. My hats off to this seller for quickly acting to guarantee his product. A great seller to buy from and I highly recommend him and both the 6" and 8" digital calipers.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Au Sanders

customer_reviews.title: This is my first digital vernier caliper and it's really good
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this digital vernier. I cut small pieces of wood for craft projects that my parents use in their children group at church, I like precision a lot so I've been using a regular vernier, but I always wanted a digital one and this Vinca digital vernier is really great. Quality of materials is great although the plastic piece of the screen feels a little cheap, buttons and screen are good too, and accuracy showed is good so far, they even offer you a certificate of calibration is you need it for more professional work.
customer_reviews.author: JTNTZ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy calipers
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent caliper. Comes in a bright red protective box along with instruction manual, pre-installed battery and a spare battery. Construction is pretty solid and the movement is smooth. lock screw on top can control sliding speed and lock it in place when needed. Accuracy : Out of the box, the scale read -0.01 when fully closed. Zeroed it out and hasn't been an issue since. Measures accurately and consistently. Features : I like the lcd display. It is not backlit, but does the job. easy to use buttons convert units of measurement, on/off button to conserve power and a zero button to calibrate or do step counts. Would recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Vipul

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: The product workes great for about 3 months, then the LCD screen started to go. Not a big issue, tilt it a bit more and you can still read the readings. A few months later the results stopped being accurate and started giving random readings, ignoring the zero command and restarting over and over. Changed the battery and still having the same issue, don't know if I just got unlucky or what, out of the great reviews and the fact that it used to work incredibly well originally, even while changing measuring units on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Mora

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: They do everything expected of calipers in this price range. Knocked one star off for battery life--they can go through batts fairly quickly and the screen gets dim fast. And I suspect that the accuracy diminishes as the battery starts to die. I can close the calipers, zero them out, power them off, wait a day or so, power them back on, and the display isn't still on zero like you'd expect it to be. But again, this is only when the battery is very low. Keep fresh batteries in them and they're great.
customer_reviews.author: B$

customer_reviews.title: Awsome deal and they past the calibration test with no issues
customer_reviews.text: Ok Iv had these for a little while now and I have to say I'm really impressed with them. I'm not going to get in to how they work because it's obvious there good the past Aerospace calibration and got certified as the pictures shows. There not as nice as my Mitutoyo's but there $300 plus. But for the price of these you can't go wrong. Even if they only last a few years. You can buy a few of them and still be under the price of the top brands and they work just as good without a doubt!
customer_reviews.author: ole skool vp

customer_reviews.title: Great value, nice feeling tool doesn't feel cheap, has a great protective carrying case.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought multiple sets of these calipers now - one for the workshop, one for my CAD station, another in my backpack... They've got less wiggle than other budget calipers, and slide really smoothly. The other thing that I really like about them is the carrying case. It snaps shut very securely, and has rubber pads to hold the calipers in place so that they're not getting bumped or jostled around when you carry them. I've owned a few pairs from HF Tools, and a few knockoffs from overseas, and these Vinca calipers are my favorites out of the budget models that I've tried. Great value for the price, and a nice solid feeling tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, works,
customer_reviews.text: 1) The battery and data cable cover can come loose easily and could be lost. 2) I'd really appreciate a description of the pinout. I understand why Vinca is reusing USB connectors. But this is one case where reusing it does make the cable 10 cents cheaper but accidents 100x more likely. But overall, for the price, this can't be beat. I had a cheap plastic caliber before with worse battery cover problems and general crappiness for not much less money. Vinca's looks very solid.
customer_reviews.author: M Tian

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for what we pay for this. I like the features, changing from imperial, metric, and fractions. Outstanding customer service, open to ideas, and input. Note: The caliper does not come with the required cable. You'll only need this if you connect to computer... For maybe CAD or 3D printing The ad doesn't tell you that the cable isn't included; unless you look closely. You will have to buy one if that is a feature that you need.
customer_reviews.author: g Metalwork

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. Problem is when I received it it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Problem is when I received it it was going nuts showing all kinds of numbers, not measuring anything. I printed the return label right away and was ready to ship it next day. Then I thought.....let me take the battery out and see if the electronics need to be reset, Voila, it reset itself and if worked great ever since. It would be helpful to have instructions updated so us customers don't return a good product at an amazing price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price.
customer_reviews.text: The Vinca 6"-150mm digital caliper appears to be quite accurate. The mechanical movement is a little tight compared to dial calipers, but this is not an issue for me. The unit comes with a 1 year warranty and an extra battery. It also appears to have a USB connector labeled RS232 that I need learn how to use as this would be an excellent way to enter measurements into a CSV file. Overall this caliper is a great value for the money and I hope to years of good service from this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Richardson

customer_reviews.title: A great measuring tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it would be accurate and the measurements repeatable. It reads perfect every time and will always return to zero when closing the calipers. I like the auto off and it even turns on automatically when the calipers are opened. The movement is very smooth and it's easy to dial in to the exact dimension with the thumb wheel. The fact that it switches not only from decimal to MM but to fraction as well is a often used feature for me.
customer_reviews.author: Danny L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very good product especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: This works well for me. It is a good bargain considering that it is fairly inexpensive. For woodworking this is sufficient for my needs. There has been some thought into storage, packaging. The box is lined with a sponge material and there are nubs on the lid that press on the device when closed. So the caliper rests between the nubs and the sponge when in the box. Safe from bouncing around I presume. Packaging is attractive and the box is bright red so you can locate it easily.
customer_reviews.author: njdude

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay, but Feels Kinda Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I mean it comes with lots of extra batteries and a well-made case, and as far as I can tell, it's very accurate, but it's a big awkwardly sized--maybe "cumbersome" is a better word. I dont use it all the time, so it's fine, but if I were in QC or always measuring things for work or something, I'd rather have a nicer quality piece. For the occasional use it'll see in my little basement workshop though, it's plenty adequate
customer_reviews.author: Ben A

customer_reviews.title: Worked well....once.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected when I received it. Been sitting in the tool box for the past 6 months and no longer works the second time I went to use it. Display is all over the place. Reading for 10mm ball joint constantly bounces from anywhere between 0.00 and 960.0+. Display never stops flipping out. Tried resetting as per the instructions and a new battery. I guess it was worth $16 for the one day it worked when I first needed it but I'll be looking for a better brand for its replacement
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I don't always review products. I'm posting this review because I found the process of selecting digital calipers a bit frustrating...almost a roll of the dice. My opinion is this caliper is a real deal for the money. I bought it to measure bullets to determine if I had a supplier problem or something else. It works well and results can be reproduced. I'm sure that if I was building a jet engine, I would want better. For light duty use at home or occasional work use, I believe this is a good product. The overall feel is solid and the display is easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bergman

customer_reviews.title: Great calipers for the money
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a set of Harbor Freight calipers that were pretty decent. I lent them to someone and never go them back so i went to HF to replace them and they were terrible, they felt flimsy and gritty. I tried 4 pairs at the store and all were the same. These had good reviews on amazon so I ordered them. They feel fantastic, no play or wiggle in the jaws, the measurements are consistent, nice case and well worth the additional $4.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Houston

customer_reviews.title: Digital Calipers are so much easier to use.
customer_reviews.text: Already have one digital caliper but found this one that's longer than the one I have currently. This one lets you get just about every measurement you need and has worked flawlessly for me. As with any digital caliper, the downside will likely be the battery. While many digital calipers have scales, I don't know anyone that uses the manual scale on a digital model. As with my older digital and this new digital caliper, taking the battery out when not using will prevent battery leakage/corrosion/damage and also the battery will not continuously drain waiting for the soft key on/off button.
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This digital caliper is very good for the money. It has not only the usual SAE and metric settings, but it also has a fractional SAE display. It's a couple of bucks more than the ones available at some of the extremely cheap distributors, but it does have excellent accuracy, judging by the number of decimal points available on the display. The thumb wheel feels excessively loose, but probably won't be a problem
customer_reviews.author: Willard P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised when I unwrapped it to see how wonderful it was made. It reads in inches millimeters and fractions. It's made out of stainless steel and easy to read. The case is very well made hard case plastic. The company is easy to work with and ask your questions within a matter of seconds. They put Pride into their product and definitely I will come back. You will not be unhappy what this digital caliper. I'm a very happy customer. Five stars all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: I have several inexpensive calipers and have made good use of them
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'm outside the return window when I began using it so I'm shafted. I have several inexpensive calipers and have made good use of them. However, this is by far the worst I've seen. Gently opening and closing it causes it to get so far from zero, it can read upwards of an inch when closed. I wasn't able to use it at all for testing some things at home. It could make a nice toothpick. Edit: the seller got in touch with me, apologized, and is offering a refund. While this doesn't make the product any better, it does speak well to the seller and add confidence in doing business with them. Added a star for customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality - great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised at how nice this caliper is. For the money I wasn't expecting much but I only had a few measurements to take and figured it would do the job. Well, I really like the quality on this... To be fair, I don't have anything else to compare it to but I can see this lasting and becoming a very handy tool in the fixture. Easy to use, feels solid in my hands and seems to be quite accurate. Nicely presented in a little plastic case and comes with a small steel rule. Not only is a battery already installed BUT it comes with a spare! Not too shabby.
customer_reviews.author: Debs

customer_reviews.title: Solid Calipers with Inches, Fractions of Inch, and Millimeters--Please revise case design
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the best calipers I've ever used. For the money, the calipers and case and top notch. My only gripe is the clasp design of the case itself. It has two clasps that require you to open the case with both hands simultaneously. I'd much prefer a single clasp that can be operated with only one hand. The calipers themselves can do in., fractions of in., and mm. Their accuracy is confirmed with my other measuring tools. They are mostly metal in construction except for the electronics box--it's plastic. The case is doesn't feel cheap. They include a spare button battery. So far I've been pleased with everything except the dual clasps.
customer_reviews.author: UkuleleJoe

customer_reviews.title: Good product for measuring items for 3D printing
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of mechanical drawing of objects for 3D printing, and oftentimes I won't have all the dimensions I need to match the thing I'm drawing to how it will connect to existing objects I'm making it for. Having a good set of accurate calipers makes all the difference. These work very well, were smooth, if a little stiff (I'm sure they'll loosen up a bit with use), and very accurate. I'd done a fast close once when I was done with them and while it wasn't important they went back to zero (as I can just re-zero it when I use it next time), but was pleasantly surprised they did.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and good quality for the price point
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily for modeling parts for 3d printing. Measurements are considerably more accurate than I need. Tool feels substantial and weighty in my hand. Automatically turns on when moving the slide. Measurements modes in mm, decimal inches, or fractional. Resolution to 0.01mm although accuracy might be slightly less. This might not be a Mitutoyo, but is less than a quarter the cost of a comparable model.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: I find this caliper gives me precise measurements everytime
customer_reviews.text: I find this caliper gives me precise measurements everytime. It’s easy to use and well made. It’s auto on feature is handy for ease of use. Easy to read and the auto shutoff saves battery power. It comes with a spare battery which is nice. The hard plastic red case protects this precision instrument. Worth the price. I paid full price for this product like the other products I review. I did not receive this product free or at a reduced priced for my unbiased review.
customer_reviews.author: Panama Red

customer_reviews.title: A real pleasure to work with
customer_reviews.text: It's impossible to accurately measure the I.D. of a circular hole, or O.D. of a circular object, with a tape measure. I love this tool. Since buying it I've used it at least five times in unexpected places, such as determining the O.D. or I.D. of a needed plug or cap for an unusual object. This is a physically beautiful tool that's well constructed with all the features I would want (and I'm an engineer). It's case is beautiful as well, so I keep it stored in the original packaging. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Baroque music lover

customer_reviews.title: Great calipers for price for hobbyists use.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is of acceptable quality for home hobby use. It seems to return to 0 fairly consistently some times off by around .01-.04mm on the gauge block after moving it up and down a fair few times. The caliper faces are well smoothed and not many sharp edges. It is perfect as a loaner or for student use. Definitely not anywhere near a mitoyo caliper in quality... then again not even in the same league of price so to be expected. Overall recommended for home use. I am personally using it for measuring objects for 3d printing at university where I dont want to risk getting my nicer calipers lost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: really is better than my previous cheapo calipers - durable case is inconvenient to open (stiff)
customer_reviews.text: I've used these calipers for a few months now, and they are a pleasant upgrade compared to my previous cheapo calipers. These have an auto-off feature, and also an auto-on that activates when you adjust them. They retain their zero calibration so its not necessary to 'zero' them on each use. The case seems to be very durable, but as a consequence its a hassle to open. Probably great for transporting, but not so fun as a safe place on my desktop to store the caliper with easy access. Overall I'm very happy with these calipers. The auto-on is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Client 89121

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value!
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost everyday. The only issues are the accuracy is not always perfect as some times when you zero it out, its right on the edge of ticking over and it bounces back and forth by 0.01mm. Also a number of times I have bumped the zero button while taking a measurement and it was not far enough off for me to notice right away. It would be nice to require holding the button for 3 seconds to zero to avoid this. I use this for benchtop CNC work in acrylic and wood.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and even better customer service
customer_reviews.text: Nearly impossible to return to zero measurement after every use, and I feel a lot of resistance when sliding the caliper. I'll stick with this for now since I don't need a genuine Mitutoyo sitting at home. Edit: After leaving this review, I was immediately contacted to try a replacement unit. I agreed, and I have to say I'm extremely surprised at the quality. The replacement unit always returns to zero readings after closing the caliper, and opening and closing it is now very smooth. I would highly recommend this product for anyone I need of a good digital caliper.
customer_reviews.author: Seonghoon N.

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be really good.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of calipers and they seem to work really well. I tested them against a ruler and a couple tape measures, the ruler showed it being off but it was obviously the ruler that was off because the tape measures both showed it as accurate. For those saying that it is stiff, all you have to do is loosen the little knob on the right and they will slide freely. Only complaint I have is that the battery compartment is right where I put my thumb to slide these and the battery cover keeps coming off. A small screw to hold it on would have made these perfect for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: VINCA DCLA-0605 Quality Electronic Digital Vernier Caliper works well
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the VINCA DCLA-0605 caliper. It's much better than my old digital caliper. It reads in millimeters, inches and fractions of an inch. It would have been worth buying if it just had millimeters and inches. The fractions are a great plus. I just make sure that when closed it is at zero or I press the zero button. It has ID and OD measurements and is quite accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Good solid feel
customer_reviews.text: Seems very good quality, measurements vs micrometer show good accuracy. Fractions available in a low-cost item. Negatives: 1. (Photo) The back plate seems from a heavily used unit! Label 1/3 peeled off, scratched, etc, holes in label showing screws were taken off. However I'm being optimistic in thinking this might have been a swap to say fix a problem with the inside measurements. 2. "coincidentally"? It seemed to die when hit with a dry-air environment static charge, but the 2nd battery made it work again. Not sure why the original battery didn't last very long, but was happy with having a 2nd supplied by company.
customer_reviews.author: Ward Christensen

customer_reviews.title: First impressions.....Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently restoring....really....remodling an old electric guitar. (Lots of modifications) So I had to have a precise measurement device. Right out of the box, this thing is very impressive for the cash spent. I have checked it against other measurement tools and it is very accurate....so far. I have already made some crucial measurements with more to come. So, time will tell. The construction and machining is very nice with a cool (in my opinion) retro 1980s color scheme and font on label. LCD display is nice. The case is great too. I will be using it a bunch over the next few months. I will update review if need be. Happy measuring!
customer_reviews.author: Murse

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy For The Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price I wasn't expecting anything great. It lives up to its specifications which are fairly good for a cheap caliper, and unlike other cheap calipers, it actually does smoothly glide across the beam. And I have not had any problems that others had reported. The only negatives, which aren't a big deal, is that all the edges are quite sharp ( I wouldn't be surprised if one day I notice I cut myself while using it), and that it is surprisingly heavy. All in all, I expect this caliper to last me a lot longer than I would normally expect from an inexpensive digital caliper.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: GOOD BUY. A-
customer_reviews.text: Nice calipers, has all the bells and whistles you except from a decent caliper. fractions, inches, MM. smooth slide, no wobble in anything everything is solid on it, depth gauge, its dead on compared to other more expenisve calipers i have compared it to. it takes a littel abuse that i have given it and it maintains accuracy. (although i wouldnt reccomend any extra abuse) alot of nice features. nice solid plastic case. By far one of the Best calipers for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Great to use
customer_reviews.text: Really like this caliper. I am an engineering student and I use this to work on some side projects especially my 3D prints to ensure I’m getting accurate dimensions on my prints. Readings are consistent, jaws move smoothly, battery life has been great too. Quality item, nice protective case, and great customer experience from a small company.
customer_reviews.author: Kal

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat price-quality here.
customer_reviews.text: I really can't complain on anything about this tool. I was reluctant at first, because I've been around mitutoyos all my life, and I felt that something 1/10th of the price would leave me hanging. Bought it because Amazon would accept it back in case I decided to return it after comparing its precision to my other two expensive shorter calipers and found it way too off. Bottom line, I am very happy with the purchase, totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Norton B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: No problems so far. Easy to use. Handles both inside and outside dimensions. I use mine mostly for sizing electronics parts, connectors, screws, etc.—very handy if you're disassembling a smart phone, for example. The display has an auto-off function so I doubt that battery life will be a problem. Display reads in any of several selectable units of measurement.
customer_reviews.author: moomadoo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The first set I got had an issue with repeatability but the seller sent me a replacement hassle free which is always great. The new set is fantastic. I don’t do super fine precision work but I’ve been using these at least weekly and they work fantastically. Always repeat measurements and very sturdy. I don’t baby them by any means and they are goin strong.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wegner

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars when considering the price.
customer_reviews.text: they work and that is the whole point.. Not stunning, needs to be zeroed often . But it works, and measurements are coming out the same .... would give 5 stars except the little thumb wheel feels "off" somewhat loose and sloppy... but the tool does the job and does it for very few dollars...
customer_reviews.author: MR Cart

customer_reviews.title: Good Calipers
customer_reviews.text: Working well. I am not seeing any of the issues that other reviews are having. Only issue I have is if you used more expensive calipers in the past, you might have a learning curve with this one. When I first tried to use them, the scroll wheel wasn't turning. You had to apply pressure to it before using. I'm use to WVR calipers which are very smooth compared to these but also cost $150. I plan to check the accuracy of them at my place of work to see how well they are.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great budget-friendly digital caliper
customer_reviews.text: I really like this digital caliper. It is easy to use and has maintained 0.00 when closed throughout the times I have used it. I recently tested the consistency of its measurement when I went through a box of loose bullets purchased at an estate sale. I measured 500+ bullets, eight different calibers ranging in size from .224 to .338. Once completed I spot-checked 10 from each group and found 100% consistency in my random sampling. As anyone who reloads knows accuracies to the thousandth is critical when measuring bullet diameter. I would buy the VINCA digital caliper again should anything happen to this one.
customer_reviews.author: WaynusQ

customer_reviews.title: Ok at first.
customer_reviews.text: Liked it overall, but after a few months use noticed that if you open or close the caliper too fast it affects the accuracy. Not too sure about the longevity due to this. Since I use this to measure the OAL and case trim length for reloading ammunition I may not use it any more, especially since I have to some times double or triple check to ensure my measurement is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Big Honkin Calipers
customer_reviews.text: I've been burned by large cheap calipers in the past with inconsistent readings. These work wonderfully! I didn't need that much accuracy, just wanted some large internal dimensions that were a pain to measure with a flexible tape measure, but these match up perfectly with my 6" Mitutoyo's. Highly recommended for anyone needing a big 12" caliper without breaking the bank
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Seldom have to reset to 0
customer_reviews.text: Like this very much so far, Like that when you pick it up after auto shutoff that it restarts as soon as you move the scale. No need to go to the start button. Wish the decimal inches and fractions were shown at the same time as I know approximate decimal equivalents of fractions and can quickly move to common fractions. Fractions with x/128 are pretty much useless to me . I'll get used to the differences quickly and really like the accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: High-quality tool
customer_reviews.text: I am very surprised by the quality of the caliper. Literally zero complaints. For $14 I expected something cheaply made and inaccurate. I wish someone explained me the point of buying calipers for $100 and more. I've spent a lot of time choosing between a very expensive brand and a cheap one, and now I feel like I was simply a victim of the hype.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir S.

customer_reviews.title: NIce Caliper
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy using this caliper. I like the analog scale along the body. The feature I had not seen in other calipers is the fractional inch display. Very handy for figuring out what drill bit to use, or what wrench size is needed for a bolt. The repeatable is very good, and it absolutely agrees with every leaf I tried in my thickness/feeler gauge. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lord BB

customer_reviews.title: Good accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I got the is to replace an old one that broke. I like it better than the old one and I paid much less for it. I am happy to see that modern instruments can be so accurate, well made, while being cheap at the same time. It comes in a hard, red plastic box that includes a spare battery. So far the consistency is good, close the jaws and zero before using, I can zero over and over and still get a good reading. I use it to make mini pistons, fire piston etc. and it works well for that.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetjunkiTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Button battery drains quickly when powered off!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for around 8 months now. The calipers work, but I've powered it on for only a few hours, yet the built-in button battery is dead to the point the LCD is practically unreadable. I had to switch to the bundled "backup battery" (which had not died in storage). I think this product has a design defect causing it to drain power even when turned off. Removing the battery caused the screen to glitch up *after the battery was removed*, showing that the device stores (and possibly draws) power even when you turn the display off.
customer_reviews.author: nyanpasu64

customer_reviews.title: A month old and already broken...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working for me today. The numbers jump around, and return widely inaccurate readings.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. Axelrod

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had owned this years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been for all my life? I've never had this accuracy in my 75 years of puttering around my shop. I'm afraid to go back an check anything I have made in the past and see how inaccurate I was. I think this will be a great addition to my tool chest and I hope my children will get some use out of it in the years to come.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: It a exelent tool for the average user
customer_reviews.text: It's a exelent product for general mechanical use it what I use around the shop for general measuring or basic machine measurements it's not the super high end machinists grade but far superior to most you will get at this price and as good as some of the mid priced machists grade products. I would have liked the thumb screw to be a little less sloppy would give it a little smoother operation
customer_reviews.author: Loren Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Great for General Woodworking
customer_reviews.text: This caliper seems just fine for general woodworking and other DIY projects. I'm not looking for super tight tolerances or the highest of accuracy and I'm not a machinist at all. I use this for aligning my table saw, understanding how far cuts are off, measuring holes etc. Comes with a decent plastic case and an extra battery. The instructions were clear. The seller reached out shortly after purchasing. For the price I think this is a great caliper depending on your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: VINCA DCLA-0605 Quality Electronic Digital Vernier Caliper does what it does PERFECTLY!
customer_reviews.text: Super Nice Piece of Equipment. Am in the process of rebuilding the Front Axle, Suspension, and Brakes of Lorrie Van Haul, the only remaining 1967 Dodge P200 Post Office Vehicle out of 3,500 Built. Needed a Digital Caliper measure the special specification Ball Joint Diameters, and Length of Tapers, plus the King Pin Diameters. The VINCA DCLA-0605 Quality Electronic Digital Vernier Caliper made all that easy peasy. Super Nice Piece of Equipment.
customer_reviews.author: JCAllison

customer_reviews.title: Best low cost caliper on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I like to keep calipers around all of my workstations, benches, machines, and even in my briefcase. I don't keep (or need) that many sets of truly amazing calipers - only for really precision work in which case you shouldn't be using calipers anyway! I've tried many of the $10-$20 digital calipers and they all fail in strange ways after a few months of use. I've had two sets of these, one for ~1 year with no issues. Even comes with a spare battery! Best for the price point I've found!
customer_reviews.author: J. Leeman

customer_reviews.title: Not Built to Last
customer_reviews.text: Initially it seemed to work pretty well. Over time it has increasingly become less accurate and more aggravating. The measurement jumps all over the place, doesn't go back to 0 when closed. Thought it may just be the battery but after trying 3 new batts, same. Purchased Feb of 2019 so I guess I'm SOL on warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: For the money you can't beat it. It's not a Starrett are BS but it is dead on. No telling how long it well last but come on for the price can't beat. I keep testing it with my blocks and steel can't belive how good it is.. The thing I don't like is the on/off.. Any movement and it's on, know auto off. So hit off botton after putting in box..
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: GREAT quality especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I paid more at Lowe's for a horrible plastic caliper that is wildly inaccurate because plastic flexes. This product is AMAZING! It's very accurate. First thing I did was check it against a known 1.75mm part and it was spot on. Secondly, I checked the inside measure against a known 5mm and again, it was spot on, reading 5.00 (no deviation). Steel calipers, accurate and they throw in 3 batteries. So happy!
customer_reviews.author: wolfen

customer_reviews.title: Extremely High Quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I saw an ad for this come up on Facebook, and figured I would try it since I have 2 calipers now that are manual and have always been meaning to get a digital. Since it was very inexpensive, I expected average quality at best. I was very pleasantly surprised by the high quality. It comes in a nice hard case, and the tool itself has some weight to it, all metal parts, and even a spare battery. I really like that you can change to fractions, standard or metric. Very easy to read as well. Can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Troiani

customer_reviews.title: Seems to change measurements
customer_reviews.text: I seem to get different readings when measuring the same item and I try to do it in the exact same place each time. It is like if I measure, then slide the gap up and down and remeasure, the number isnt the same nor is it withing the tolerance mentioned on package. This makes it tough to measure the squareness of my table saw using the 5 cut method. I will say it seems accurate enough for my purposes as were talking about some tight tolerances here. i could be using it wrong as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lane

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one of these Vinca calipers that I bought. This one for my son as a gift and the other two for me; one in the house, the other in my workshop. They are well built and easy to use. They work in inch, metric and fractional modes and are powered by easily obtainable LR 44 batteries. For about $18 you just can't go wrong. I use them so often that I made sure I had a pair inside the house and out in the workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Basspro361

customer_reviews.title: Great value, solid build
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect such a well made tool for the price. Feels hefty and solid in hand, slides well, zeros out, no gaps. Very impressed. Don't have the tools to test accuracy, so I relied on other professional reviews. Some complained about the auto-on draining battery. Not a problem. Set to zero, twist the lock nob and put it away.
customer_reviews.author: SaidWhatWhen

customer_reviews.title: Woodworking Must
customer_reviews.text: These things are accurate, easy to use, and the price is phenomenal. The accuracy and quality of my cuts has gotten much better since getting these, as has my confidence in what the hell I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Possible Explosion!
customer_reviews.text: This is what the seller sent me after purchased via email about the calipers I bought. Wish me luck. Because I'm using a different brand USB no matter what now. "CAN ONLY BE CONNECTED WITH CLOCKWISE TOOLS/VINCA AUTHORIZED DATA CABLE. PLEASE DO NOT CONNECT WITH REGULAR USB CABLE. BECAUSE THIS WILL CAUSE THE BATTERY EXPLOSION!"
customer_reviews.author: Raisedbyjunkies

customer_reviews.title: It does the job but buy extra batteries
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it does, but it turns on from even the slightest movement, thus making it on nearly all of the time. This will ensure that you're replacing batteries everytime you need to use it, because it'll be dead. The only way I can see around this is making certain you lock the slide after every use and ensure it's back in it's packaging.
customer_reviews.author: HawtDogFlvrWtr

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and well made
customer_reviews.text: I love these Calipers! They are pretty accurate, have a nice solid weight to them, and come in a nice hard plastic case. The auto on and off features are very convenient. They appear to be pretty accurate. Never being much more than .01mm off which, for the price, is close enough to accurate for a hobbyist like me.
customer_reviews.author: Terri D.

customer_reviews.title: not great. Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: Meh... not great. Not Bad. Middle of the road Chinese Calipers. Battery life isn't great. Off button turns off display, but main "computer" remains on to drain battery. Always seems to zero out at -0.005" for some reason. But hey... For the price? Cant complain.
customer_reviews.author: Fox M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: 'Decent' Cheap calipers. You get what you pay for here--its not a scientific instrument, but if you want to measure something fairly accurately in the 0.1mm range this does the trick. Fairly uncomfortable to use, with sharp edges and a roller wheel that doesn't really work. The accuracy is pretty good, and it is reasonably precise. If you need high accuracy, get something else or make three measurements l, zeroing in between, and average them. Better than a ruler, but not good for high precision machining.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Viener caliper
customer_reviews.text: I've had the caliper for about one week now. It's very easy to use, and being digital, I can take measurements in fractional inches (1/3", 9/32" 1/2" etc.), decimal inches (.25, 1.75, etc) or millimeters. This is my first digital vernier caliper. It seems to be very accurate. The company - Vinca- sent me an email follow up just to make sure I was happy with my purchase. I am.
customer_reviews.author: ithacalarry

customer_reviews.title: Accurate to Close Approximate
customer_reviews.text: It beats not having one by a mile. You may get a variance of 1-2 millimeters when you re-measure so if you already know the length you need to match something to, you can make a "good enough" approximation. But, if you're trying to establish an initial length and you need on-the-nose accuracy, you may need to step up to a higher class of caliper. I've now used this one on three different projects and it has served me well.
customer_reviews.author: Pret813

customer_reviews.title: Great for in the field
customer_reviews.text: I probably use these more than most people as I am in the field a lot and if I brought expensive ones they would either be stolen or suffer some form of battle damage. They slide smooth, measurements are pretty accurate for the most part and their warranty is actually a warranty. I had one unit fail and they ended up replacing it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Boz

product_meta.title: VINCA DCLA-0605 Quality Electronic Digital Vernier Caliper Inch/Metric/Fractions Conversion 0-6 Inch/150 mm Stainless Steel Body Red/Black Extra Large LCD Screen Auto Off Featured Measuring Tool
feature_bullets: Higher quality lower price stainless steel digital caliper with inch/metric/fraction conversion; Home DIY and professional use are both highly recommended
Fine polished stainless steel and NEW processing of depthometer's groove give better looking, smooth sliding, and accurate result
Measure Range: 0-6 inches/150mm; Display: 1/2"x1 1/2" (13mm x 38mm) extra large screen; Accuracy: ±0.001"/0.03mm; Resolution: 0.0005"/0.01mm, 1/128"
Each digital caliper has been fully calibrated before ready to sell (NO calibration certificate included)

Featured RS232 Data transfer port, must connect with "VINCA DTCR-03" Cable to make data transfer to PC. DO NOT CONNECT WITH REGULAR USB CABLE. Patent in the US; Comes with one extra battery; 100% satisfy guaranteed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,518 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
